basics.name: Lee Macaulay
basics.label: Multimedia journalist
basics.summary: Multimedia journalist with nearly five years experience working in professional newsrooms for the BBC and commercial radio. Originally from Kendal, Cumbria, I've worked as a journalist across the North East, Cumbria and Lancashire.

work.summary: Reporter, producer and newsreader on the BBC's local radio station for Cumbria which reaches around one in three adults a week.
highlights: Regularly read bulletins, produce breakfast programmes, report live and write for the rolling news service BBC Cumbria Live.
Helped BBC Radio Cumbria lead regional and national coverage of the closure of the Lakes Line in 2018.
Produced digital videos for BBC Cumbria's social media platforms.
Reported for BBC Radio 4, BBC Radio Wales and BBC Tees during the 2015 Cumbrian floods and for BBC Radio 5 Live Breakfast on Sellafield chemical disposal in 2017.

work.summary: Wrote, produced and recorded news summaries every half hour which are aimed at young commercial radio listeners around the world.
Gathered audio and wrote copy for hourly bulletins on Bauer Radio's commercial radio station broadcasting to North and West Cumbria. Updated social media and wrote news articles for the web.
highlights: Reported from the Morecambe Bay inquiry report event for the Bauer City Network.
Reported from the 2015 General Election for the Bauer City Network.

work.summary: Gathered audio and wrote copy for hourly bulletins on Bauer Radio's commercial radio stations for the North East. Updated social media and wrote news articles for the web.

highlights: Produced and edited a package for weekend bulletins
Wrote and cut video for breakfast bulletins

work.summary: Worked with a team of young broadcasters to make radio from, and about, the UK radio industry’s biggest event. Edited, co-produced and co-presented daily podcasts and produced a package about future user interfaces in radio.
